result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • William C Brushwood was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall not enter establishments whose primary purpose is the sale/serving of alcohol.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall provide DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: Forthwith, with Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

superMiscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not consume alcohol.

Defendant shall not enter establishements whose primary purpose is the sale/serving of alcohol.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall provide DNA sample.

Defendant shall obtain/maintain full-time employment, schooling, or combination of both.

Defendant shall obtain/maintain stable residence.

Defendant shall pay any oustanding financial obligations as previously ordered.  If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision.  If extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with financial obligations owing, a judgment shall be entered.

Def in person & by Atty Gary R Schmaus.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper appeared for State.  Clerk: CP.  State puts recommendation on record.  Def free to argue re condition time.  State moves to dismiss and read-in Ct 2; Court so orders.  Def acknoweldges prior OWI convictions.  Def enters guilty plea to Ct 1.  Court finds def guilty on Ct 1.  Discussion re Information as was previously filed prior to def waiving prelim; Court reviews Information filed 5-28-15 w/def.  Statements from State, counsel and def.  Court proceeds to sentencing.

Partial joint recommendation, free to argue condition time.  Due to time constraints, Court will not proceed with a plea and sentencing today.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 09:00 am.
